verbose_text: Antidepressants are recognized elements of pain control in human medicine, and they may act through a number of pharmacologic actions; for example, by blocking reuptake of noradrenaline and 5-hydroxytryptamine through direct and indirect actions on opioid receptors; inhibiting histamine, cholinergic, 5-hydroxytryptamine and N-methyl-d-aspartate receptors; inhibiting ion channel activity; and blocking adenosine uptake (Sawynok, 2001).
